page.title: 14Transport in Alford
page.content: The family car is how most travel, though bicycles, motor bikes, buses, taxis and Shanks pony are also used. A dog sledge was even seen one winter's day! The daily bus service to Aberdeen is adequate but costly. Private companies introduced community buses this year linking Alford with the surrounding villages and towns. Alford houses Grampian's Transport museum, opened in 1983, and showing the development of road transport in Grampian. Special events are held in the arena- the best known being the annual Alford Cavalcade, a vintage vehicle rally held in July. The dis- used station buildings opened again in 1984 as the Alford Valley Railway museum. From there Scotland's only 2 foot gauge passenger railway runs through Haughton and Murray Parks.
